benchmark_details.name: AssoCiAm
benchmark_details.overview: AssoCiAm is a benchmark designed to evaluate associative ability in multimodal large language models while circumventing ambiguity through a hybrid computational method.

purpose_and_intended_users.goal: The primary objective of AssoCiAm is to provide a more accurate and reliable evaluation of associative abilities in multimodal language models.
purpose_and_intended_users.limitations: While focusing on associations based on object shapes, further work is needed to address the diversity of answers.

data.source: The dataset consists of images and associated question-options pairs created by a hybrid computational method.
data.annotation: Images are filtered and generated based on representative masks to ensure quality.

methodology.calculation: Accuracy is calculated based on the proportion of correct answers selected in the evaluation.
methodology.interpretation: Higher accuracy indicates better associative ability and cognition in models.
methodology.validation: Extensive validation was conducted using human participants.
